you get a lot of snow during this storm?

know my thought for the meeting discuss what kind of our onboarding and rollout looks like in the most structured format, which appeared to be what your company was looking for and team and then just quickly reviewing the commercial option.
We offer an annual upfront payment or a month to month payment, which is slightly more, you know, per month.
He's just running a little behind so we can spot.
Sorry, I was a little late.
Francesco is going to be joining in shortly.

Yeah, and I wanted to jump in here because I know we spoke briefly on a previous call, but in a lot of my previous roles, I've dealt and I've helped with deployment and everything.
So it's where I hope to add a lot of value in this process.
So let's talk a couple of steps in terms of what's required.
Number one is we're happy to discuss pricing and everything and come and get to a space where we're comfortable with the terms of this engagement.
Once that is done, we'll probably send you a formal contract.
It's essentially a court that you can execute, which is essentially accepting the terms that we've discussed.
Once that is done, we will raise a request internally with our success team who will assign a member dedicated to your account.
And once that is done, essentially, we've got three stages to cross.
We use typically a portal where we track all of these stages and that's a collaborative portal that we'll send you.
But we've essentially got three stages.

Because we get started as quickly as possible… okay?
I was going to ask that question?
You know, you say quickly as possible.
Can we get it up and running tomorrow?
Well, I think that's what Francesco wants to hear once he joins us.
We were just briefly sort of going through what needs to happen next.
So I'll just give you an abridged version just to catch you up to speed.
So essentially now that we've decided that we're good to get started.
What we do is if we're all aligned at the end of this call, we'll send over a formal quote which is the terms of our agreement from pricing and term and everything.
Once you execute that, we will raise a request with our team internally to dedicate a specific success person for your account.
This person will be your dedicated point of contact.

And they will of course, be with you throughout the time of your engagement with hiver making sure that you've got and your account does what you need it to do.
So those are overall just like an overview of what this, what the next steps look like.
But like I said, I'm happy to answer any questions.

Typically onboarding for a team of your size does not take more than a week, 10 days.
If the team is available, that could be even quicker but, yeah.

going to be assigned to someone, but it's going to be assigned to someone part of a shared environment where everyone has access.
